title: Ticket #795: Amazon Proxy does'nt support proxies requiring user authentication
description:
The Amazon gahp is unable to use a proxy that requires user authentication. The following errors appear in the amazon gahp log:

09/29 14:37:59 Using proxy server, host=localhost, port=3128 09/29 14:37:59 Using http proxy = http://localhost:3128/ 09/29 14:37:59 Call to DescribeInstances failed: SOAP 1.1 fault: SOAP-ENV:Server [no subcode] "HTTP/1.0 407 Proxy Authentication Required" Detail: <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/strict.dtd"> <html><head> <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1"> <title>ERROR: Cache Access Denied</title> <style type="text/css"><!--BODY{background-color:#ffffff;font-family:verdana,sans-serif}PRE{font-family:sans-serif}--></style> </head> <body> <h1>ERROR</h1> <h2>Cache Access Denied.</h2> <hr> <p 09/29 14:37:59 Command(AMAZON_VM_STATUS_ALL) got error(code:Server, msg:HTTP/1.0 407 Proxy Authentication Required
remarks:
2009-Oct-07 10:50:30 by jfrey:
I've reviewed the patch and have one comment:

If a username and password aren't given in AMAZON_HTTP_PROXY, then the proxy_userid and proxy_passwd fields of the soap struct in AmazonRequest are set to point at empty strings, rather than NULL. That may surprise gsoap. Someone should verify that it works properly.

2009-Oct-07 14:04:18 by rrati:
Tested and verified code words against proxy that doesn't require authentication.

2009-Oct-27 16:19:14 by jfrey:
The check for config param SOAP_SSL_CA_DIR introduces a memory leak. It should also check for SOAP_SSL_CA_FILE, which is an easy change to make.

2009-Oct-27 16:23:31 by jfrey:
Pushed a patch to V7_4-branch for 7.4.1 that addresses the issues mentioned above.
derived_tickets: #1465   SOAP_SSL_CA_DIR/FILE don't work in amazon_gahp
attachments:
• amazon-proxy-authentication.patch 4038 bytes added by rrati on 2009-Sep-30 15:59:18 UTC.
    This patch will provide support for defining a username:password in the Amazon proxy variable in the form:

    http[s]://[<username>:<password>]@<host>:[<port>][/]

    It also adds support to define "SOAP_SSL_CA_DIR" to a directory containing trusted CA certs (to verify server)
